direction.raw_text: slowly builds: the rhythmic rocking of a TRAIN'S WHEELS over RAILROAD TRACKS...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: jolts awake. Sunlight hits his face. He blinks. A stunned beat. He's disoriented. Slowly he turns his head to one side...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Filling most of the seats. Office workers on their morning commute into a city. Turning the other way, he's confronted with a window. Trees flash by, splitting the rising sunlight into a hypnotic strobe pattern. Colter looks to be thirty years old. A military buzz cut. A disciplined physique, lean and spare, almost gaunt. Skin burnished by years of desert sandstorms and equatorial sun. His expression, prematurely aged by combat, is perpetually wary, sometimes predatory, accustomed to trouble. Despite his military bearing, Colter wears a button down shirt and navy sports coat. On his wrist is a digital watch. It reads 7:40 a.m. He swallows. A strange, creeping panic. He has no idea where he is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The train hurls straight at us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- Skimming alongside as the train twists and turns, sucking up track -- feet, yards, miles of it. Beneath it, the curving rails, which the rushing train barely seems to touch. They vibrate with an eerie, dulcimer HUM.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colter hasn't moved. By his side he sees a canvas MESSENGER BAG. Is that his? Tentatively, he lifts the edge of the bag to look inside. A red APPLE rolls against two LIBRARY BOOKS. The bag's leather
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: reads: "SEAN FENTRESS." It's not coming back to him. This whole experience is starting to freak him out. He catches the scent of something. A passenger walks by with a STEAMING CUP OF COFFEE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Two rows back, an OVERWEIGHT MAN opens a can of soda. Sitting opposite Colter, facing him, is a WOMAN in her late twenties (CHRISTINA). In contrast to the corporate suits around her, her appearance is thrift store funky: black nail polish, dark lipstick, black hair with blue streaks, a button- down blouse edged in black funeral lace with silver skull-and- bones cufflinks. She's busy writing in a journal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ma'am? Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me... ma'am? She looks up. Blank stare.

direction.raw_text: What is this?

direction.raw_text: Where am I?

direction.raw_text: (looks out the window) Almost at Newark. Goes back to her journal.

direction.raw_text: What's Newark? A city?

direction.raw_text: It's more of a hell hole. But Colter still doesn't understand. He gets up. Nausea slams into him. He hangs on to the seat.

direction.raw_text: He freezes. It's a mirror image of the first car. But no, the passengers are different. Beside him there's a small door. Thinking it's the bathroom, he instead opens it to find a CONDUCTOR'S COMPARTMENT. A cramped office with chairs and surveillance monitors.

direction.raw_text: I don't think I...

direction.raw_text: Have to write you up then. He pulls out a citation pad.

direction.raw_text: But I've never been to Princeton Junction. See... I don't remember waking up or buying a ticket or getting on the train or anything else. It's just a blank.

direction.raw_text: Lucky you. The jaded conductor moves on. Colter is alone with his confusion. Takes a deep breath. The nausea has eased slightly.

direction.raw_text: Okay. You're gonna figure this out.

direction.raw_text: Entering the first car again. The rows of passengers. Must be at least forty people. As he walks back up the aisle, he looks from face to face: A pale COMPUTER ENGINEER reviews some documents. A forty-something SECRETARY does a crossword puzzle.

direction.raw_text: a stock broker type, talks on his cell phone:

direction.raw_text: slumped against a window, eyes shut, listens to an MP-3 player. An OLD MAN with a faded wool suit clutches a cane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: female, European, 20s, hiking boots, examines a guidebook. A dowdy OFFICER MANAGER type sorts supermarket coupons into a tabbed file box. An African American EXECUTIVE reads a newspaper. None of them pays any attention to Colter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of AIR -- he turns to An AIR-CONDITIONING VENT. The HISS of AIR sound sinister. Like the exhalations of a creature.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He looks to see A woman FILING HER NAILS. Colter cringes. Every detail, every sensory impression seems heightened, near the point of overload. He reaches Christina again. Eases back in the seat across from her. She writes in her journal, ignoring him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . There's something else in his sports coat. A WALLET. He turns it over a few times, inspecting it. Pulls out a

direction.raw_text: . Another man's face is in the photo. The name on the license reads: "SEAN FENTRESS." The same name as on the messenger bag. The street address on the license reads: "58 Alexander Road, Princeton Junction, New Jersey."

direction.raw_text: Sean Fentress? Who the hell's that? And why does he have this guy's wallet? He leans forward to speak with Christina again.

direction.raw_text: Ma'am? She lowers her journal, annoyed. We see she hasn't been writing but DRAWING. A well-executed sketch of a face.

direction.raw_text: Why do you keep calling me ma'am? How old do you think I am, anyway?

direction.raw_text: I'm having a little problem here. I'm trying not to freak out, but I think something's happened to me.

direction.raw_text: Like what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like, total memory loss. Complete. I don't know how I got here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you drank too much last night. So did I. Unfortunately, I remember the whole thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not it. See... I'm a pilot. I fly helicopters in Iraq. I'm in the army. She waits for more. As if he's telling a joke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was on a mission. Right before I woke up here I was in the middle of a mission...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Wavering. Unsure of himself. His memories.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boy, you really did drink a lot last night.

direction.raw_text: I'm telling you the truth.

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Now approaching Newark Station. Newark Station, next stop. The train begins to SLOW DOWN. A few people begin to get up. The platform of Newark Station slides into view.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These aren't my clothes. And this wallet here... He holds up the driver's license. One final attempt to convince her.

direction.raw_text: You see this? This isn't me.

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take a look in the mirror, good sir. The mirror? She goes back to her sketchbook. Determined not to be interrupted again. Anxiety ripples through Colter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This can't be happening. The train lurches to a stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Newark Station. Colter gets up. Through the windows, a few passengers disembark onto the platform: Derek, the Old Man, the College Kid and GUZMAN, a Middle Eastern man, who HURRIES past all of them towards the station building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Colter only half notices all this. He's intent on reaching the train's BATHROOM, the door of which is now OPEN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) All aboard. Doors are closing. Christina watches Colter go. Curious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) This is a New York bound train. Next stop, New York - Penn Station. The train begins MOVING. Colter reaches the bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A fluorescent light flutters on as Colter shuts the door. He's in a tiny space with prefab restroom fixtures in stainless steel. He SHOUTS in surprise. Recoils backwards. Eyes locked on
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Staring back is SEAN FENTRESS'S FACE. Not his own. He's frozen there. Heart pounding. Seized by cosmic panic. He SLAPS himself in the face. Hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wake up! The restroom rattles and tilts with the motions of the train, obliging him to hang on. This isn't a dream. At least not one he can wake up from. The other guy's face stares back at him. Blinks when he blinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Warehouses go by in a blur. The train is entering New Jersey's industrial zones on the outskirts of New York City. From her seat, Christina stares at the messenger bag which Colter left behind. Then up at the closed restroom door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Her hand knocks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. You okay in there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colter sits on the closed toilet seat. Head buried in his hands. Scared. Desperate for it all to end.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christina's holding Colter's messenger bag. She talks through the closed door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You left your bag on the seat. Which is a flagrant violation of rail security, leaving a suspicious package behind and all that. I probably saved you a huge fine. No answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll just leave it right out here for you. She places the bag beside the door. She hesitates at the door. The oddness of this situation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colter stares into the mirror at the stranger's face. Practically catatonic at this point. And then her voice -- CHRISTINA (O.S.) If it'll help you remember, you've been riding this train every morning for three months. Her words rouse him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three months?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christina's walking back down the aisle. The car rocks to one side as an EXPRESS TRAIN flashes by on the opposite tracks, going the other way. A blur and a whoosh, and it's gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the verge of opening the door, Colter hears a METALLIC RATTLING. Two SCREWS are rattling around in the sink. Colter picks up a screw. Turns it over and over in his hand. What are they doing in the sink? He looks UP. An overhead VENTILATION PANEL has been PRIED OPEN. Above it is the darkness of a CRAWL SPACE. Something is sitting up there. From outside comes a TRAIN HORN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Through the windows, a FREIGHT TRAIN is passing the other way. A moving wall of metal boxcars and liquid tankers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colter looks up into the crawl space. Can't quite see the object up there. Moving carefully in the tiny space, he stands up on the toilet. Grabbing onto the ventilation panel, he WRENCHES IT all the way open. Then PULLS himself uncomfortably upward. On tip-toes, he looks into crawl space and discovers
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's an enormous device. Several large CANNISTERS tied together, full of sloshing liquid. Barely discernible behind wires and gaffing tape is CELL PHONE -- the bomb's detonator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Running footsteps from outside. Commotion. An ALARM sounds.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: -- THE BOMB EXPLODES IN COLTER'S FACE WITH A HUGE AND DEAFENING FORCE, INSTANTLY KILLING HIM

direction.raw_text: S -- THE BOMB EXPLODES IN COLTER'S FACE WITH A HUGE AND DEAFENING FORCE, INSTANTLY KILLING HIM.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: INT.
location: CONTINUOUS THE FIREBALL RIPS THROUGH THE CAR -- KILLING CHRISTINA AND ALL THE OTHERS

direction.raw_text: Fuel lines explode in the other cars in a horrendous chain reaction. The fire is spectacularly bright, lighting up the windows of the rowhouse apartments facing the tracks. Nearby TREES INCINERATE, mere matchsticks amid sheets of flames. On the rowhouses, a ALUMINUM DOOR MOLDINGS begin to MELT in the intense heat. One of the FREIGHT CARS, loaded down with coal, shuddering from the blast, wobbles a few yards then PITCHES OVER -- ROLLING off the rails, tipping right off the elevated tracks... It FALLS through the air and SMASHES into the middle of an traffic intersection below with a shattering force. The cascade of EXPLOSIONS continues. Large portions of BOTH TRAINS are ANNIHILATED, while the heat reduces the heavy- gauge steel rails back to elemental, molten ore. And then... An odd sound, like a BALLOON loosing air or MACHINERY winding down as we
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . All sounds cease. For exactly 1/3 OF A SECOND, a mysterious PATTERN OF LINES appears. Like METAL RODS, maybe. RADIATING OUTWARDS. It makes no sense. An abstract pattern. Then it's gone. Many will not even see it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Now there is only darkness. Nothingness. Seconds pass. The CLICK of an INTERCOM switching on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) This is Beleaguered Castle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're VERY CLOSE on Colter's UPSIDE DOWN face. His eyes flutter open. He's surprised to find himself alive. Consternation flashes through him as he discovers that he's tightly strapped in. He now wears a military flight suit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Captain Colter Stevens, this is Beleaguered Castle. Acknowledge transmission. The measured calm of a mission controller's voice comes over Colter's headset.

direction.raw_text: Later. We're still in the tiny chamber. It's stabilized. As has Colter, but in the manner of a dangerous wild animal given a sedative. Embedded into the controls is a two inch-square VIDEO MONITOR. It shows the face of GOODWIN. He's a middle-aged communications officer. Although we know him as Goodwin, his military name badge and rank insignia have been covered up. He wears a headset and sits surrounded by banks of electronic equipment and keyboards. He peers in at Colter, exuding the blandness of a military flight controller.

Four of clubs. Nine of clubs. Three of hearts. Nine of hearts. End of thread two. Beads of sweat on Colter's forehead. What the hell?

direction.raw_text: Over DARKNESS, the SOUND of BACKGROUND CONVERSATION. Engineers speaking in technical jargon. Click. The unit's VIDEO MONITOR comes on again, illuminating Colter in its glow. His graying hair is windblown and unkempt. His eyes are piercing blue. He wears a track and field warm-up jacket. He looks in at us with an unsettling Cheshire-cat grin. He puffs on his pipe. Winks. Pressing a button he -- Click -- shuts the whole thing off again. Sound and picture vanish. Leaving us suspended.

direction.raw_text: At the passing woodland scenery. He's back on the train. Back in the same navy sports coat. Across from him, Christina is at work on her sketch pad. Just like before. Other commuters all around him. Everything is exactly the same as before. Note: The remaining story will follow this "binary pattern." Scenes will take place either on the train or in the capsule. Compared to tomb-like isolation chamber he just came from, the train is exploding with sensory input -- the smell of steaming coffee, the cramped proximity of other passengers, the crinkle of an freshly-ironed dress shirt, the glint of a buckle on a purse, the slanting sunlight, the trees out the window, bursting with summer leaves. Almost unintentionally, Colter finds himself repeating the same opening actions as last time -- checking his watch (7:40 a.m.)... turning at the scent of passing coffee... peeking in the canvas messenger bag beside him... This time, however, he takes the books out of the messenger bag. The books are stamped "NEW YORK PUBLIC LIBRARY." He also takes out the APPLE. Sniffs it. Takes a bit. It's good. No, it's awesome. Crisp and delicious.

But he HOLDS HER TIGHT, shielding her with his body and squeezing his eyes shut as -- THE EXPLOSION RIPS THROUGH THE TRAIN -- EVERYTHING VAPORIZES. Blinding light. Painful to look at. Like a star exploding. A dull, hollow sound of WIND rattling through an abyss. And then the ghostly still life. Details flicker into view: A bicycle. A stone wall. And next to it... A woman. It's Christina. Turning to look at us. A gentle, reassuring smile.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: -- THE EXPLOSION RIPS THROUGH THE TRAIN -- EVERYTHING VAPORIZES

direction.raw_text: Click -- click. Click -- click. The video monitor is malfunctioning. It flickers on and off, revealing Colter's face in and out of darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The capsule is nearly shut down. The controls appear non- functional. Ice crystals have formed over the circuitry. Colter hugs himself, shivering. His breath is visible in the capsule's tomb-like cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goodwin? What's happening? Come in. Can you read me? It's goddamn cold in here. He hits a few buttons. Almost at random. The VENTS which had been blowing in air FALL SILENT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goodwin, I'm losing oxygen. The monitor fizzles out. The light from the controls FADES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goodwin! It's now COMPLETELY DARK. He BANGS on the side of the capsule. Just a muffled thump. A terrifying silence. The SNAP of a harness releasing. A THUD as Colter falls to the floor of the capsule. Cursing. Some sounds of thrashing around. Then... The SPARK of a BLUE FLARE illuminates Colter's face. He's activated a miniature signal light on his flight suit. It begins to BLINK. Like a beacon for downed pilots afloat in the sea. It is the only light in the otherwise dead capsule. Up on his knees, he grasps the release handles of the EXIT HATCH. Using all his strength he TURNS... But the handles don't budge. The hatch remains sealed. He gets to his feet. Can't stand up fully. The capsule is incredibly cramped. Rifling through a cabinet, he discovers OPERATIONAL MANUALS in small, almost illegible type. And a small set of TOOLS. He spreads them out on the tiny ledge. Taking a wrench, he
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on the escape hatch. A deep, clanging ECHO in the hull.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . So, like any pilot would, he sets about repairing his craft. At first he puzzles over the electronics and circuitry. Daunted by the complexity. There's no time to lose. Using a miniature screw driver, he begins unscrewing the monitor panel. His fingers are slow and clumsy in the frigid cold and the screw driver slips out of his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Icicles have appeared over dormant air vents. Colter, ice crystals in his hair, is shivering more violently. Much of the capsule's electronics lay open and exposed. Using copper wires, he's attempting to revive a row of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They spark once... twice... Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on! Another SPARK. It shocks him. There's a puff of blue smoke. He's burned his fingers. But the battery now has a tiny BLINKING GREEN LIGHT. Working fast, Colter attaches the copper wires to the leads on the battery. From inside the engines comes a faint electric HUM.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The monitor awakens. Like a film projector it throws the image of a PLAYING CARD onto the opposite side of the craft. Colter begins replacing the monitor components. As he does, a pre-recorded AUDIO FILE comes on:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: four principle dialects of Arabic: Egyptian, Gulf, Syrian- Lebanese and North African. We will now play you portions of each, discussing the audible differences between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of SPOKEN ARABIC begin to play. Colter continues reconstituting the computer. The monitor fills with scrolling lines of COMPUTER CODE. With an oddly low-tech CLANG, the heart of the machine reawakens. The air vents come back to life. Heat starts to return. The icicles begin to DRIP.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Colter sits back in his seat, exhausted from the work. The monitor switches to a real-time view of the LAB. Goodwin's chair is there, but Goodwin is not in sight. In a background distorted by the FISH-EYE LENS, various technicians wander by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? Anyone out there? It's me. He toggles an audio jack. Then a MAN comes walking up. Frowns into the camera, as if through the foggy lens of another world. It's the MAN WITH THE PIPE. The elusive Bohemian scientist whom Colter glimpsed once before. He will be known as
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you hear me? Rutledge is tinkering with the camera. The image shakes for a moment as he adjusts it. Then puts on a headset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Project designer initiating sequence and drives check.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm here! I'm okay! Rutledge checks his headset. Not sure he heard right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is someone there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. It's me. Colter. Rutledge blinks in surprise. The blue eyes sparkling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow! It's you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The capsule lost power. It's still pretty cold in here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've been working towards you from the other side. Nice to have you with us again. You feeling all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think so. Who are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The name's Rutledge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They wouldn't let me talk to you before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I guess not. They're pretty anal around here. (lights his pipe) Don't tell them you saw me smoking in here, okay? His genial eccentricity is completely at odds with the military environment. And then it occurs to Colter:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're the inventor of this thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I prefer the term project designer. And sorry for all the secrecy. Goodwin will be thrilled you re- established contact.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to deal with Goodwin anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you understand? He's torturing me. I'm helpless. Can't you get me out of here? Rutledge looks uneasy. As a scientist, he's ill-equipped to deal with personnel issues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would Goodwin have it in for you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a remote operator. And remote operators are risk averse pussies who sit at control screens in the rear while actual pilots like me put their asses on the line in the field.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He seems pretty devoted to the mission.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And just what kind of mission is this? Talk to me, man. Why won't he let me save those people on the train?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because they can't be saved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not? I know what's going to happen. I could take apart the bomb. Stop the train.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah but you'd be doing it in the Source Code, not here. Not in our own past. Mystery upon mystery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the difference?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not sure I should be telling you this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Telling me what? Coaxing the scientist in him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's quantum physics. Linear algebra. Parabolic calculus. It would take weeks to explain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is Source Code time travel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Rutledge sighs. Looks at his pipe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's gone out again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why can't I save those people on the train?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think of it like this: events in our past can never be undone. Einstein proved that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So Source Code opens up another past for you. A parallel past. It looks the same but it has no intersection with our own world. In essence, by sending you back, an entirely new but utterly parallel world is created. It looks identical to ours, but nothing you do there has any effect on this reality. At last some useful information. Colter races to process it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happens to the Source Code world after I leave it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. You can never know that because you're not there to observe it. Maybe it vanishes. Maybe not. (UNEASY) I should tell them you're okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about the bicycle?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What bicycle?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see it each time. Right after the bomb goes off. Like an after image. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a bicycle and a stone wall and a girl. It's a girl from the train. I don't know where any of it is supposed to be, but -- Rutledge removes the pipe from his mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait. You see all this after you leave the train?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Just for a split second. Rutledge is stunned. Like he's discovered some strange new property to his invention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please tell me you're not making this up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. It's there. What do you think it means?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Rutledge looks off camera for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're here. There's no more time to talk. (QUICKLY) Make sure he sends you back in. Find out about the after images. Goodwin appears. Rutledge reluctantly takes off his headset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rutledge, wait. Don't leave me. Rutledge steps away. A pointed look at Colter. Goodwin settles back into his seat, donning the headset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Welcome back. How are you feeling?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm alive. No thanks to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You find the bomber?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a brick wall, Goodwin. A fucking brick wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lower your pulse. The situation has worsened. The fire on the tracks caused one of the freight cars to blow up and release some kind of gas. As a precaution they're having to evacuate all of lower Manhattan. Evacuate lower Manhattan? The enormity of this. Having to take it on faith.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We may have lost the initiative.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean? Let's keep going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were expecting more from you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can give you more. Let me think for a second. But Goodwin ignores him. Absorbed in paperwork.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The freight car blows up from the fire. It spews gas, or what could be gas -- it might be chlorine, so they can't take any chances. Anxious now. Trying to make up lost ground. Whatever it takes to get sent back in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So they decide to play it safe and evacuate parts of New York City. And maybe that's part of the terrorists' plan, right? (THINKING) So... so who benefits from that? What's vulnerable? What's down there in lower Manhattan? (BEAT) Wall Street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Surprising himself with this insight. And now Goodwin is paying attention again. Waiting for more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wall Street. That's what they're going to hit next. The financial markets. Goodwin considers this. For the first time, slightly impressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to show you something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The video monitor shows CHRISTINA's DMV shot. Her wry, secretive smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did she die, too?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. This drivers license photo was found with her body. We're creating a database of recovered identifications as they come in from the site. A pang of sorrow. Moving among ghosts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure she's dead?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like to see her morgue photos?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was sitting across from me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) We know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Playing a GRAINY, HAND-HELD VIDEO of the TRAIN WRECKAGE. Rescue workers in protective gear picking their way carefully through the twisted, charred remains of the two trains.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) This was taken shortly after the rescue crews arrived on scene. The TIME CODE on the image reads 8:26 a.m.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) We noted the location of each corpse when we pulled it out. On screen, rescue workers pull a CHARRED CORPSE out of the wreckage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Prepare yourself. This is unedited footage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you I didn't want to see her! The camera ZOOMS IN on a corpse. Its burned face, like a piece of rotted fruit, fills the screen. Nevertheless, we recognize it. And it's not Christina. It's someone else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Sean Fentress. The man in the mirror. Himself, at least on the train.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He died on the train.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) As a host identity, Sean Fentress had to have certain basic similarities to you. Gender. Blood type. Approximate age. His head was still intact. We need the head, you see. To link the two of you remotely. They carry the corpse towards a MORGUE TRUCK with a vast array of SATELLITE COMMUNICATION EQUIPMENT attached to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The image freezes, then DISSOLVES back to Christina's DMV photo. Silence. Pondering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like to see the other passenger photos? Perhaps that would help you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You still have Christina's body? The other things she was carrying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to know about her. Everything I can. She's not just another victim. She's connected to all this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The rich smell of steaming coffee. The glint of a polished leather shoe. The crisp click of someone uncapping a fountain pen. The scenery rushing by -- the blur of trees, the soft lavender of the morning sky. The swell and pull of the mighty machine coursing over the rails. If a train ride could ever be a sensory delight, this is it. To Colter, every sensation has become even more pronounced, more intensely real than ever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON - HIS WATCH - A beep as he sets it to countdown again from seventeen minutes. The duration of his freedom. Across from him is Christina. Absorbed with her sketching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thirty six dollars and eleven cents. She looks up at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In your wallet. Right now. Thirty six dollars and eleven cents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this a magic trick or something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. In five seconds, a guy's going to open a can of soda.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! The Overweight Man opens his soda can. She gives Colter a quizzical look. He points out the window. They're passing a neighborhood of modest homes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're about to pass a street with willow trees. Two girls will be jumping rope. A white dog's going to run out behind them. A Dalmatian mix. In a moment, they pass a scene exactly as Colter described. Christina's befuddled smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to tell me how you're doing this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Close observation. You could say I'm a collector of moments.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A collector of moments?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the cheesiest line I've ever heard. She resumes her drawing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You trained to be an artist. No response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got A's in line drawing and oil painting. But your work didn't sell. You took a job answering phones in a law firm. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Six months ago you moved back in with your parents. Two weeks ago you put your paints away for good. The sketch book is all you have left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who the hell are you? Who have you been talking to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me? No. I haven't ever talked to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But we have, Christina. You've drawn all these people here. You know their routines. At one point you thought you were different from all of them. But now you're not so sure. Christina has gone white. Utterly incredulous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A small bar area. Coffee sloshing in styrofoam cups Colter hands one to Christina and sits down opposite her. A glance at his watch shows TWELVE MINUTES left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, you've got my attention. Now tell me what this is all about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need your help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you selling something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen to me. I can't use up any more time trying to convince you. I just need you to believe everything I'm about to tell you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This better be good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bear with me. (beat, where to begin?) Your sketch book. Is there a drawing of me in there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, Christina.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, fine! Here. She flips through it. Shows him a sketch of SEAN FENTRESS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did it last week.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The thing is, that's not me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me a little credit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. You drew what you saw, but the person you're seeing now is someone else. I'm not Sean Fentress. I'm not really on this train.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not really on this train.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm taking someone's place. Borrowing it. My name is Colter. I'm a soldier. And I'm being held prisoner. And this is the only way
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the only time and place I have -- to figure out how to escape. She gives him a blank look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After three months of riding the train, this is how you introduce yourself to me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm serious. Elements in the American military are using me for an experiment. I'm not sure exactly how it all happened, but I'm at a facility on Nellis Air Force Base in Nevada. Right now. As we speak. It's a project called Source Code.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Source Code.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a program. It shifts identities. It also performs small amounts of time travel. Or "time engineering." I don't know the jargon. He's not getting through to her. It's too bizarre.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been put on this train to look for someone. A criminal. And I need to find out just enough about him to keep them putting me back on this train. Because right here's only place I can figure out what's really happening. But I have very little time. And each time I come back, you won't remember me and I'll have to go through this all over again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are, I think, deliciously mad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then how do I know all those things about you if we've never spoken before? She doesn't have an answer. Can't easily dismiss him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why tell all this to me? There's lots of people around for you to talk to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I think you have the answer to this whole thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Believe me, I don't have the answer for anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a vision. I keep having it. It's very powerful. And you're in it. And there's a bicycle. And this... old stone wall. And it's very peaceful. Does this sound familiar? Like where you live, maybe?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stone walls? My parents live in a house with aluminum siding and an American eagle over the door. The only bike is a Harley which the guy down the street revs at three in the morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The vision must mean something. It's the only time when I'm not on the train or in the capsule. Why else would Rutledge be so interested?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's Rutledge?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone who was trying to help me understand something. Until they got to him. He lowers his head. A dead end. No answer. The train begins to slow down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Now approaching Newark Station. Newark Station, next stop. Colter looks at HIS WATCH. Ten minutes left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw a program on TV. It was about psychics. They say psychics have a lot of paranoia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't believe in that shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Newark Station. Through the window, the Old Man, Derek and the College Kid disembark. Guzman hurries past them to the station house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) All aboard. Doors are closing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you have people you can go to for help? Friends, family? The train begins to move again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) This is a New York bound train. Next stop, New York - Penn Station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Most of my friends are in the military. My dad runs a melon farm in Alabama.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe now's the time to reach out to him. She hands him her cell phone. Colter just holds it in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me and my dad, we don't see eye to eye. We're just two different people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As opposed to being the exact same person?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you always this sarcastic?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is so not about me. Colter reluctantly dials. As it rings -- COLTER What day is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: June 11th.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: June? One more thing to puzzle him. The call connects. An OLDER MAN, DONALD STEVENS, answers. The gravelly voice of a Midwestern farmer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Hello?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad? Donald doesn't respond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad, it's me. It's Colter. Again, silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Been a while, huh? I'd been meaning to call you, but -- Click. The line goes dead. Colter looks at Christina.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He wanted me to stay on and take over the farm but... I had other ideas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're intimidated by him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're scared of him. I can see it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hell I am. Challenged, he redials. Braced for conflict. The call connects.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad, don't hang up. We're going to talk. I need your help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now you listen to me. Whoever you are, never call here again. Donald hangs up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's still mad at you, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... it was like he didn't even know who I was. Troubled, he hands back her phone. Outside, the EXPRESS TRAIN flashes by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know how to help you. She feels bad for him. And something inside Colter closes. Retreating inside himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry to have bothered you. He gets up to go. Christina stays where she is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back in his seat. Lost in the view out the window. The neighborhoods have given way to Newark's industrial fringe. Bringing him closer to the inevitable end.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I have a friend. Surprised, he turns to find her there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She works at the New York Times. Her name's Stephanie. She's just a proofreader, but she wants to be made a reporter. She's always saying she needs a good story to bring in so she gets noticed. Something like this, with a crazy paranoid angle could really interest her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She could do some poking around. She's already quite suspicious of the government. Christina's dialing her phone. Colter turns back to the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm getting voice mail. (into the phone) Steph, it's Christina. You know that story you're always looking to write? I might just have something for you. I met a guy. His name is Colter Stevens. He says he's in the army. He flies helicopters in Iraq, but now they've put him into a secret project called Source Code. Maybe you can look into it a bit, okay? Call me. She hangs up. Pleased with herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She'll call back. Just wait. None of it will do Colter any good, but he manages a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ma'am? How old do you think I am? He gives her a wary look. Considers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twenty five? She smiles, pleased.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, but thanks. (BEAT) What did you mean, there's a criminal on the train? How do you know that? Colter looks away. Careful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can I help you if you don't tell me everything about this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colter enters the tiny space. Christina is reluctant to follow him into the bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said you wanted to know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't you just tell me? He gives her an imploring look. She sighs and squeezes in next to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Try anything and I'll kill you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut the door. As she shuts the door, Colter gets up on the sink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing? He wrenches back the ventilation panel, then steps aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's up here. He holds out his hand. She grabs hold and steps up on the sink. She's not quite tall enough to see into the crawlspace, so he steps up behind her and lifts her the rest of the way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (startled, feels his hands
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you -- COLTER Just look. Her blouse brushes his face as he holds her up. A long beat as she looks inside the overhead space at the bomb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Acetone Peroxide. It's a liquid explosive. There's fourteen cannisters of it. Simple detonator. Cell phone signal closes the circuit and boom. He lowers her. An incredulous beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you put this here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. It was someone else. They don't know who. That's why I'm here. To find out. Watching her. Will she believe him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to tell someone. We have to stop this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bathroom door opens and Christina walks quickly away. Mounting fear. Colter falls into step behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It won't matter. The train's already...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Already what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been sent here. It sounds crazy, but it's true. I've been sent from the future -- from five hours in the future. This train's already been blown up. She backs up. Scared of him. Every right to be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanted to know. Now you know. She turns and hurries for the exit doors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't happening. I've got to get off. Colter catches up with her inside the exit vestibule. She's stabbing at the door release button.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why won't it open?! Her phone is RINGS. They both stop. She looks at the number.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Steph. (HOLLOW) I told you she'd be interested. (ANSWERS) Hi. Her eyes are fixed suspiciously on Colter as she listens. Colter looks outside. Recognizes the terrain. Looks down at
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It's awful. Unbearable. He dashes towards the bathroom -- INT. TRAIN BATHROOM - MORNING Tears open the door. Jumps up on the sink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sits in the semi-darkness, faintly illuminated by the bathroom's fluorescent light. As he grabs hold of the bomb, he hears -- CHRISTINA (O.S.) Colter...? Working fast, he unhooks the leads on the detonator, rips away gaffing tape -- jostling the cannisters of explosives -- CHRISTINA (O.S.) Colter, I have to tell you something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and pulls off the detonator cell phone. Ducking back down, he see Christina standing in the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look. Now the fucking thing can't go off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reads 20 SECONDS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stephanie did a computer search. Something in her expression worries him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's got a database of all newspaper articles going back to forever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Source Code's classified. It wouldn't be in a newspaper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. But you were. She found you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She found me? What does that mean? She stops. Not wanting to go on. From outside comes the HORN from the approaching freight train.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus Christ, Christina, are you going to spit it out? In his hand, the CELL PHONE RINGS. Colter's eyes light up in amazement -- the DISPLAY SCREEN is showing the name and number of the bomber. But before he can read what's there, Christina's voice finds its way to the back of his brain:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: According to the notice, you were killed in action two months ago. The world stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: him. He drops the phone and doubles over. She runs to him -- COLTER'S POV 67. Everything around him PIXELATES into a hundred thousand
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on an array. Christina's cries become bursts of static. Flying behind the array come LINES OF COMPUTER CODE - - the Source Code architecture laid bare. And then the screen itself seems to melt, giving way to a frightening series of HALLUCINATORY FRAGMENTS:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- desert sand, searingly bright -- flight deck instrumentation -- a windshield pockmarked with bullet holes -- the horizon tilting as the helicopter PLUNGES towards earth amid a chaos of RADIO TRANSMISSIONS:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...taking a lot of RPG fire... be advised A61 is going down... A61 is going down hard..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Black smoke. Boots crunching on sand as we are borne,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: , a victim on a jostling stretcher.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Airborne again. The thud of rotors. Through blurred vision we see medics working furiously to save a life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The smooth, glassy calm of 30,000 feet. The regular pulsations of a VENTILATOR. Fluids drip down through an IV bag. Tubes and monitors stacked all around us. Gurneys of other wounded packed together. The grumble of another, unseen wounded soldier:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Never any damn leg room on a plane. An ALARM begins beeping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Hey, this guy's crashing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Silence and darkness. Nothingness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Then, a PLAYING CARD appears, as if through a slide projector. The Jack of Clubs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Captain...? The playing card flickers, separates into pixels, then dissolves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Captain, allow me to introduce myself. My name is Goodwin. You're with Beleaguered Castle. You are safe. All your needs will be met here. Lines of computer code flit across the screen. A blinking cursor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A tiny APERTURE opens... revealing CHRISTINA. And the bicycle. And the stone wall. The strange, recurring vision.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Captain? The sound drives away the image, replacing it with
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Captain, just tell me what you see. Just look and speak. Groggy breathing. A ragged voice:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I see a card.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Very good. Very, very good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On Colter's face. A deep, cold knot in his stomach. Shuddering in fear. The truth before him now. Crouching there, a nightmare, ruling over him. On the MONITOR, Goodwin looks into the camera. Assessing the situation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you comfortable? Are you warm? Colter clings to his harness as if to keep from vanishing entirely from existence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you need to urinate? Colter swallows. Too terrorized to speak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beleaguered Castle is waiting for your report. Goodwin taps his pen on his clipboard. Impatient. He flips a switch. A blocky COMPUTER VOICE, something out of the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: s, comes on:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Hearing Test. First sequence. Left ear. A short SERIES of ELECTRONIC TONES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Hearing Test. First sequence. Right ear. The tones cease. Colter remains impassive and inert.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain, I know you can hear me. Did you find the bomber? Goodwin keys in some commands. Forever adjusting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Memory Thread One: "When Lily woke, she had the bed to herself. She sat up, bewildered by the strangeness of her surroundings; then memory returned, and she looked about her with a shiver." Goodwin stops the audio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As you're collecting your thoughts, I should tell you there's been another development. A terrorist group has taken responsibility for bombing the train. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This began broadcasting over the Internet a half hour. We've traced it to central Asia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A grainy VIDEO shows an arid, wind-swept plateau of a far- away desert. It is twilight. A MUJAHIDEEN FIGHTER, his face hidden by a hooded cloak, sits cross legged before a flickering camp fire and a tea service. The fighter rises, picks up a rocket-propelled grenade launcher, and approaches the camera. The wind whips his black robes. The figure looks slight. Almost spectral. It begins speaking to the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (on camera, in accented
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By now you have suffered a taste of divine vengeance. God willing, you will soon suffer another. Colter does not raise his head. No idea whether he's even listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These attacks will show you that you will never be safe. You can secure your borders. But what can you do against one of your own citizens? One who looks like you, who is blameless, living already among you, who takes eighty million of our dollars, a trifle, and carries out our bidding? You cannot stop this. Time has run out. The image freezes. Then switches back to the live feed of Goodwin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me talk to Rutledge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you've decided to speak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rutledge. Get him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We appreciate your desire for further discussion. Perhaps at a later date.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you let me out of here? Goodwin ignore the question. Continues making notations.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frankly, Captain, we're disappointed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Find Rutledge! Now!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to say that we expected more from you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop! Stop reading from your goddamn script!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps we overestimated your abilities.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I swear to fucking Christ!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please accept the criticism in the spirit it was given. Perhaps a few memory exercises would help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't need your criticism and I don't need your memory exercises, you gutless freak. And by the way, that bomb is detonated by a cell phone. When activated, the phone's display screen displays caller ID information. Caller ID. I wonder if that information would be useful to Beleaguered Castle. For a split second, Goodwin looks thrown. But the mask of the cold clinician goes back up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very well. We're ready for that information.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll have to send me back. I didn't get a good look at it. But I will next time. Goodwin hesitates. Skeptical.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What assurance do we have you'll be able to read the screen before the device detonates?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goodwin, there's no time left. Send... me... back. Goodwin's pale, inscrutable face fills the monitor. His eyes are unblinking. Unfeeling. Nothing behind them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colter prowls the aisle feverishly. He scans the overhead luggage rack. Peeks inside a bag. Doesn't see what he wants. He looks all around... up the rows of passengers... intently scanning... There. The Computer Engineer. He's asleep. But clutched in his hand is what Colter wants -- a CELL PHONE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON - THE COMPUTER ENGINEER - MOMENTS LATER The train jolts slightly, waking him up. Looking down, the Computer Engineer notices that his cell phone has vanished. Across the aisle, a LATINA OFFICE MANAGER taps him on the arm. She gestures down the aisle to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's walking off with the guy's cell phone. Behind him, the Computer Engineer gets up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, do you have my phone? People turn to look. Among them is Christina. Colter just starts walking faster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dude, give me back my phone!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Computer Engineer hurries in. Colter is nowhere in sight. He RUNS down the aisle and towards the next car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: OVER to the DOOR of the CONDUCTOR'S COMPARTMENT as it
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Breathless, Colter has just finished shutting the door and is about to use the cell phone when sees
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and a TRAIN OFFICIAL Looking over at him in surprise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. Wrong turn. Reversing gears, Colter backs out of the compartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just as the befuddled Computer Engineer disappears into the third car, Colter steps back into the aisle and walks the other way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sweating a bit now, Colter is keying in a number on the cell phone as he walks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Operator. City and listing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Las Vegas, Nevada. Nellis Air Force Base.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Connecting you. A tingle up his spine. The call connects.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Post Operator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this... Nellis Air Force Base?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Yes, sir. How may I direct your call? He takes a deep breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm trying to reach... Captain Colter Stevens. Calling himself. Strange. No idea where this is going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I have no listing for a Captain Colter Stevens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then give me the Combined Air and Space Ops Center.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) One moment, sir. The call seems to take forever to connect. Then a terse military VOICE comes on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) C Deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) C Deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm calling for Rutledge. It's urgent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) You have the wrong number.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Captain Colter Stevens. An eerie pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Would you repeat that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colter Stevens. Captain Colter Stevens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Hold the line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Now approaching Newark Station. Newark Station, next stop. The train slows at it pulls into Newark Station. Another voice comes over the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Captain? This is Goodwin. Colter's heart sinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Where are you, Captain?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me talk to Rutledge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you? How did you find us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm on the train. The train pulls to a stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Newark Station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) What train?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't know. It hasn't happened yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) What hasn't happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The explosion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) What explosion?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) All aboard. Doors are closing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you understand? I'm in it, Goodwin. I'm calling you from inside the mission. Inside the Source Code. A beat of stunned silence. The train begins moving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Next stop New York Penn Station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) This contact is ill-advised. I must ask you to hang up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goodwin, I'm trapped in this and I can't get out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) You have no authorization to be making this call. Goodbye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! Wait! Don't hang up! Forget authorization. There's no time. Soon you're going to find out what happened on this train. And then your own day is going to start. But not until then. Right now it's just you and me talking. And you're a different Goodwin than the one I'm going to go back to in a few minutes. You're separate from him. Separate worlds. Do you understand?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I think so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. Now there's a lot of secrecy in all of this, and you have your reasons for that. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But here and now, just this once, I need to ask you something. And you need to tell me the truth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I'd rather you not ask me anything, Captain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to ask it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I should terminate this call.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus, Goodwin, how can I get through to you? You're not just a soldier. Somewhere inside you're a human being, too. Somewhere inside you've got to know that this is wrong. Source Code is wrong. And if you can't grasp that, if you just follow orders, then you're just as much a prisoner as I am. The car SHUDDERS as the EXPRESS TRAIN FLASHES BY. Quiet returns as it recedes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) What's your question? Surprised, Colter raises his head. Draws a breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did I survive that helicopter crash in Iraq? Silence. Colter shuts his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Answer me. Did I survive that crash? Another pause. This is crushing Colter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goodwin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Not physically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You did not physically survive the crash. A terrible chill comes over Colter. He swallows. Trying to stay brave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not physically? Fuck. At least give me an answer I can understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) We've kept alive certain areas of your brain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But... the capsule I'm in...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) A manifestation. Your way of making sense of it. This is crushing. Colter fights back terror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You had no right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) As a soldier...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was a soldier. Then. But now? (WHISPERS) After death?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) It was the only way. You couldn't have a body and be sent back into the Source Code. (BEAT) What is the status of your mission? Is it a success?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You really want to know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I suppose not. You're right to keep it from me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what we do. Keep stuff from each other. Will this ever end?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) End?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can I get out of this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) You must realizes the army's made an investment in you. You'll be used again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Imagine a turntable. With a record spinning on it. All we do is lift up the needle. The music stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Then we wait. Until another mission. And the needle comes down again. You won't remember any of this. We'll start with the playing cards. Electronic tones. Simple memory exercises. Bit by bit, we'll revive your cerebral capacities once more. The barbarism of it. Digital slavery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many times have I done this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Does it matter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one knows I'm here. No one can help me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) In stimulating your cortex, they're prolonging your life. Many soldiers would find that preferable to death.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't do this. I served my country. I already gave my life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) The courts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) The courts know you're here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Military court or civilian court?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Military. Colter finds no comfort in this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I'm sorry you found out about all of this. That wasn't our intention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does that make it any less wrong? No answer. Colter looks down at his watch. Time is running out. And there's absolutely nothing he can do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ashen. Almost lifeless. Around him is the darkened steel cocoon of the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Its appearance has altered slightly, given Colter's new awareness of what this really is. The capsule is even more claustrophobic. There are fewer controls. Even less light. A shadow world. The monitor is blank. He shouts from the void -- COLTER Goodwin?! Rutledge appears. Drops into the seat and puts on the headset. Fiddles with his pipe as a way to avoid looking at the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's it going? Any breakthroughs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I finally get it, Rutledge. You're the good guy, Goodwin's the bad guy. Working together, you get what you want out of me. Why didn't I see it before?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Believe me, Captain, I'm on your side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drop it. I know about the helicopter crash. I know what they've done with me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, it's been a long day. For all of us. But now we've got to bring this home and catch a killer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's in it for me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on. These guys are serious. Help me out. My ass is on the line, too, you know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can do better than that. They sent you here to offer me a deal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you think I'm enjoying this, you're wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's their offer? What can they possibly threaten me with after so colossally fucking me? Spit it out, you spineless turd. Rutledge's face goes red. Quite possibly no one has ever spoken to him like this before. After a sputtering pause, Rutledge's mouth hardens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The government can decide to take an interest in people. People like your father with his struggling farm. It can discover things like unpaid property taxes. It can call in his equipment loans or tie him down for years in environmental litigation. On the other hand, it can pay him handsomely for mineral deposits he never knew were there. As distant and problematic as your relationship was, surely you'd like the chance to do something for him. A beat of silent outrage from Colter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those after images I saw. You never knew about them. They weren't part of Source Code architecture, were they?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're meaningless. Nerves firing. Brain chemistry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't believe that. I've been to places you haven't. I've crossed and recrossed that line between living and dying. And when I do, that veil gets lifted for just a second. And what's there is real. Maybe it's a vision of the next world, but I can see it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can see it. But you can never get there without our help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get there? What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our offer. Maybe we can get you there. In return for your completing the mission. (BEAT) They'll let you die. I'll shut off your life support and you'll simply slip away. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just like the good Lord intended you to do a few months back. A fearful beat. Negotiating over his own soul.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'd never do it. You wouldn't have to. You could just flip the switch and start me back up again unaware. For all I know, you've made this deal with me before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually, we haven't. Your operational awareness has become too great. If you found out the truth about yourself once, you might do so again. As for Source Code, I'm sure we can find other servicemen coming back from overseas with wounds just like yours. (PATRONIZING) Do you have the courage to serve your country one final time? Colter's eyes bore into Rutledge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to find you, Rutledge. Someday. Somewhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (retreating from the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The display screen on the detonator was a useful and exciting insight you made. This time, make it pay off. Get the information on the screen. But let the bomb explode. We need the force of the explosion to help integrate you quickly back into the present. The Source Code machinery is already beginning to HUM. Rutledge excitedly keying in system commands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You hear me? Somehow, I'm going to find you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I doubt that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . There's barely time for Colter to grab onto the harness restraints before the machinery goes into a deafening HOWL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Colter's body convulses and goes limp. Unconscious, he sags in his seat, held in by the harness. Everything SWITCHES OFF AND GOES DARK. A split second later, the capsule comes back to life again. As if the plug were simply put back in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain? Colter JOLTS AWAKE. Disoriented. Thrashing to get free.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay. Calm yourself. You're back. Colter exhales. Shuddering. He's just completed another Source Code.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened? The tentacles of the nightmare slowly releasing. Replaced by the oppression of being back in the capsule. Back in Rutledge's power.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was the bomber's identity on the cell phone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think so. But there wasn't time to read the screen. As soon as it rang the bomb went off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about the phone itself? Make, model, product identification number.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was unable examine the phone without separating it from the detonator -- which I was instructed not to do. His delivery is different now. Impersonal. Distant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you make any other progress? What in heck's name did you do for those seventeen minutes? Colter does not answer. The machinery again STARTS UP. Colter tenses, bewildered. Eyes dart accusingly to the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait. What are you -- THUNK. Again, he convulses and goes limp. Click. Darkness. Everything POWERS DOWN... ... And BACK UP again -- controls, monitor, machinery. Colter GROANS and opens his eyes. Gripped by another terror. Returning from yet another trip on the train. Another bomb blast. Death and resurrection. Rutledge looks in on him with impatience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can do this all day. Until you get it right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please... I don't feel good...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't doubt it. Who's the bomber?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know... I honestly... I can't keep... The HUMMING again. He's helpless. An insect on a pin. Colter tears at his restraints, ready to bash his brains out against the controls. He SCREAMS...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and, in sudden freedom, surges up out of his seat with a cry. Around him startled passengers look over in confusion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Colter, back in his navy jacket, slacks and shirt, has pitched forward into Christina.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to get off me? The Overweight Man, wide eyed in surprise, has his finger poised to open his can of soda.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go ahead! Open your fucking soda!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! The Overweight Man complies. Some half-muttered reproaches, then most people go back to what they were doing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong with you, anyway? She glares at him at he stands up. He can't respond. Despair surges through him. He stumbles off down the aisle. But where can he go? There is no freedom. No escape. Imprisoned in both worlds. From her seat, Christina watches him go. Sensing the torment in him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colter is slumped in a corner. Christina appears. Taps him on the shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You okay? He eyes her furtively. Like a cave man who's never seen another human being before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not okay. He's ghastly pale. He's sweating profusely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ma'am, please... return to your seat. Footsteps. The sound of jangling KEYS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ticket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The conductor takes up position in front of him. As implacable as Rutledge, in his way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ticket, please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not feeling well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He still needs a ticket. Colter makes no move to respond. No more concern for anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have it your way, pal. He takes out his book to write Colter up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait. I'll pay it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have no idea where he got on. Full fare's $22.50.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, all right. Getting out her wallet, she pays the conductor. He eyes her with disapproval, then shambles off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see customer service is alive and well on New Jersey Transit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why did you just do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ticket? I don't know. You looked a little lost. The gratitude in his look makes her self conscious. She turns to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you do me a favor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get off the train.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Now approaching Newark Station. Newark Station, next stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please. Just get off the train. Her puzzled look. The train begins to SLOW DOWN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't my stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You shouldn't have been on this train, Christina. You should be living another life. Not spending it answering phones for lawyers.
direction.name: direction
