direction.raw_text: How do you...? A group of passengers approaches the exit area. We've seen them all before: Derek, the Old Man, the College Kid. And the small encounters: shuffling around, positioning at the doors, and the College Kid tapping Derek on the arm, holding out Derek's wallet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, you dropped this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (relieved, takes it back) Wow. Thanks. The train stops. The doors OPEN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Newark Station. Derek, the Old Man and the College Kid get off. A second later, Guzman bursts past them, making his nauseated run for the station. Leaving just Colter and Christina there. The doors stand open, invitingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone has a destiny. And this isn't yours. He steps out onto the platform. Holds out his hand for her to join him. A coaxing look. She's incredulous. This guy. His words. This whole moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who in the world are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just do it. Stop being afraid. Believe in yourself. He waits for her. Only two steps away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) All aboard. Doors are closing. She blinks. The spell breaks. Those two steps prove to be two much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave me alone. She retreats back into the car. Colter is heartbroken. About to pursue her, he happens to look over and see
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Instead of going directly to the station house, Derek continues walking down the platform alongside the train, as if intending to reboard further down. And then it happens. With a quick motion Derek TOSSES SOMETHING through an open door of another car, then heads quickly away towards the station house. With no time to think, Colter slips back on board just as the doors slide shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The train begins moving. Christina is nowhere in sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) This is a New York bound train. Next stop New York - Penn Station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Intrigued, Colter leaves the exit door area...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Strides down the aisle of the second car... and reaches the next set of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's nothing there. Whatever Derek tossed inside is gone. Did someone pick it up? Colter looks up the aisle and then the other way into the next car. No one there. Once more he examines the exit area. Gets down on his knees. Then he spots it -- an OPENING between the floor and one of the wall panels, only a few inches high. And there something lies. Colter slides it out. Derek's WALLET. Intentionally left here. The same wallet the College Kid gave back to Derek earlier. Opening it, Colter pulls out Derek's DRIVER'S LICENSE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Source Code has finished. The monitor shows just the empty chair. Finally Rutledge returns to his seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They've searched the wreckage and found the wallet. It was under the wall panel. Just as you said. An awkward dynamic between them. They despise each other but have to work together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Believe me, he's our guy. He tossed his own wallet back on the train. Only reason he'd do that...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (finishing his thought) ...is if he wanted us to think he died in the explosion. I know. (BEAT) We looked into his profile. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Derek Frost is a commodities trader, with a wife, two children and a promotion one month old. He's an emergency preparedness volunteer on his office floor, for God's sake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You saw that terrorist video -- they said it was one of us. One of our own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If he's really the one, you can find out the rest of his plan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By any means necessary. There is no Geneva Convention in the Source Code.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Torture him, you mean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Find out the plan, before it happens here. And then I'll let you die. Their grisly bargain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the conductor's compartment there's a fully loaded 9 millimeter handgun locked in a safe. Think you can remember the combination?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christina is absorbed in her sketch book. Across from her, Colter watches. A stranger to her again. It hurts too much. She feels his eyes on her. When she looks up, he's gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Guzman exits the bathroom, he almost crashes into Colter, who's waiting right there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Assalam'alaikoom. Squeezing past, Guzman does a double take to hear the standard Arabic reply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reaching into the overhead crawl space, Colter once again unhooks the cell phone detonator from the bomb. Sitting down on the toilet seat, he dials 4-1-1 on the cell phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) What listing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The New York Times.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christina's CELL PHONE RINGS. She gets it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Christina? It's Stephanie. Where are you right now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Going to work. Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) The strangest thing. The phone rang at my desk and some guy I don't know said the train you're on isn't safe and that you should get off at the next stop. Then he hung up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? The train begins to SLOW DOWN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Now approaching Newark Station. Newark Station, next stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Maybe you should get off. Are you okay? The station platform slides into view.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm fine. Everything's normal. Is there something on the news? Some kind of alert?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Nothing that I've heard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The train pulls to a stop. Passengers begin to get off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Newark Station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christina is out of her seat, debating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I think you should get off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be late for work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) The hell with work, Christina! You hate that job anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's probably a joke. A weirdo guy from somewhere. She sees Colter down in the exit area. They lock eyes. And somehow she knows. He made the call. Colter quickly disappears into the other car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The doors stand open to the platform. Just then Derek's
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: goes skidding back on board, disappearing under the wall panel. A second later, Colter reaches the exit area.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) All aboard. Doors are closing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The train doors shut. Colter is now out on the platform. Christina is not there. Concerned, walking quickly forward, Colter looks through the windows... And finds her staring back at him. Still on the train. A strange moment between the two of them. Once again he's failed to save her. They watch each other for as long as possible, until the train pulls away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the train SPEEDS UP, Christina sits down again, lowering her phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Did you get off...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I'll call you back. She hangs up. Disturbed. As if she's failed some test. But what test? Why this weird feeling?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) This is a New York bound train. Next stop New York - Penn Station. The train SPEEDS UP. Anxiety creeps into her face. Looking around, the tranquility of the passengers begins to seem ominous, hinting that she's made the wrong choice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The conductor enters. About to pour himself a cup of coffee
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh? The metal door to THE SAFE has been OPENED.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Inside the quiet lobby, Derek is heading for the outer doors to the parking lot, when:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Derek Frost. Colter is walking towards him, holding up Derek's WALLET.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You forget something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gosh. Is that my wallet? As he goes to take it, Colter GRABS HIM.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Behind the closed door at the end stall comes the sound of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - The men's room DOOR flies open -- Colter DRAGS Derek inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell, man? What the hell???
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You see this? Colter pulls out the DETONATOR CELL PHONE -- the one he took off the bomb. Holds it inches from Derek's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now you can't blow it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is this? Get away from me! The BARREL of a 9 MM PISTOL. Aimed right at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Believe me, I'm very accurate with one of these things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus. Derek raises his hands. Sweating. All fright. Like a decent man, terrorized. It gives Colter pause. Does he have the right guy? A toilet FLUSHES. The last stall door opens and Guzman emerges. Stops cold as Colter swings the pistol at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay there, my man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't hurt me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop acting, for Chrissakes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep my wallet. Take my watch. Take anything you want. Unprompted, Guzman takes out his own wallet and sets it on the counter. Calmer than Derek. Accustomed to trouble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There. Now you have two wallets. Take them and go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up! Tensing. This isn't supposed to happen like this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please. I have a family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about those other passengers? Don't you think they had families?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just what is this about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This man's a terrorist. He planted a bomb on the train.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Click. Colter pulls back the hammer and savagely JAMS the barrel of the pistol into Derek's cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the next attack? Who else are you going to kill today, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God... Oh God... Guzman takes a step towards Colter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One more step, asshole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't treat him like this. He's not an animal. Neither are you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen to him. For God's sake I'm not a terrorist...!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: spreads on Derek's pants. He looks down, ashamed. Colter keeps the gun on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Piss all you want. You took eighty million dollars to kill hundreds of people today.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eighty million dollars? I swear to you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then what about the wallet, huh? Why the fuck did you twice try to leave your wallet on board?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time's up! What is it?! What is the next attack! So help me, I'll put this bullet through your brain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what you're talking about!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to do it. Tightening his finger around the trigger. Tears are streaming down Derek's face. But he's not going to talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would never hurt anyone. I have a family. I guess you'll have to kill me. But Colter can't. He can't shoot him. He lowers the gun. Disgusted with himself. Why can't he do it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You see? You are a human being. Speaking gently. Trying to calm him. Even as Colter feels like he's failed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This can be worked out. We can listen to each other. The temperature cooling. Derek's nodding with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything you want... Please... The detonator CELL PHONE RINGS, startling all of them. Confused, he answers the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Who is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christina?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Are you the guy who was sitting across me on the train? Colter looks at his watch. The countdown passes THREE MINUTES. 2:59... 2:58...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can you be calling this number?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) My friend had it. From when you called her -- to try and get me off the train. Who are you? What do you want? Derek and Guzman cautiously lower their hands. Watching in confusion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was trying to warn you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) About what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not sure that it matters now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Talk to me. I feel that something terrible's going to happen. Do I need to get off the train? Am I going to die? He can hear the b.g. noise of the train on the other end.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm right here, okay? Don't be afraid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't I get off the train? (SIGHS) I knew I should have driven in today. But then there's the bridges, right? You never know when they'll be jammed. That stirs something in the back of Colter's mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bridges. You just never know when they'll be jammed. His heart starts racing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the train. Earlier. Derek in his seat, on his cell phone. Colter nearby, overhearing him:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trust me, by one o'clock, the bridge is going to be jammed...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colter looks to Derek. His stomach sinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "By one o'clock, the bridge is going to be jammed." That's what you said. You knew. You knew there was going to be an evacuation. You knew before it happened. All those people walking across the... The realization hits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're going to bomb the bridges. While they're full of people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A slight flicker travels across Derek's face. Like a disturbance on a surface of deep water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) What are you talking about. Who's going to -- Over the phone comes the HORN from the passing FREIGHT TRAIN. Colter presses the phone to his ear, trying to hear her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christina? Just hang in there. You'll be okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: closes over his gun. Before Colter can react, Derek
direction.name: direction

result.heading: TURNS THE GUN BACK INTO HIM -- 101

direction.raw_text: ! BLAM!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Colter staggers back -- slumps to his knees. Guzman cries out -- makes a run at Derek -- who spins and -- BLAM!
direction.name: direction

result.heading: DEREK SHOOTS COLTER TWICE IN THE CHEST

direction.raw_text: . Spent shell casings roll to a stop on the tile floor. A terrible silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) What's happening? Are you okay? Are you there? Derek picks up the phone and terminates the call. He coldly evaluates the two men dying in pools of blood. Then calmly walks out. As the life slips from Colter's eyes, he manages to focus on his beeping WATCH -- Where the seventeen minutes have RUN OUT. And the world
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... In the haze comes the mystical vision again -- but deeper in:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: now curves over our heads, becoming a TUNNEL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: walks away from us -- down into the tunnel. The far end is ablaze in WHITE LIGHT. We try calling to her. But our voice is weak and faint. She continues towards the light... and we do not follow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The monitor is dark. Everything is still. Colter in his seat. For long seconds we watch his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .F.B. - DAY A jarring transition. We are now away from Colter's P.O.V. and in the real, physical environment of the Source Code operations center. Military and civilian personnel work amid mysterious scientific equipment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Rutledge talks on a wall phone. Like a team player serving his country.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes... We appreciate that... I just hope the information has come in time to clear the bridges... Thank you, sir. When he hangs up, he turns to Goodwin and a few other
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Naked ambition courses through him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whether or not they can stop the bridge attack, we came up with the intelligence. And that virtually assures all of our futures. This is just the beginning, guys. (TO GOODWIN) You did a great job, Goodwin. You operated our captain with skill and professionalism. What's that you have? Goodwin opens an envelope and slides out a CITATION.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Army investigated Colter's helicopter crash in Iraq. Apparently he stayed behind to fly protective cover for a disabled convoy until he ran out of fuel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's this, then? Some kind of posthumous reprimand for reckless flying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. It's the Silver Star. Something in Goodwin's voice momentarily checks Rutledge's breezy good humor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Send it on to his father. It'll ease the pain of his son's death.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought I might inform the captain of the citation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Better not. We can't risk acquainting him with the citation in case the memory wipe isn't entirely clean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The memory wipe?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought we were going to let him die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know, I know. But now the Director of National Intelligence is sure to want a closer look at our program, and until we train up another candidate, we'll need to keep Colter around to demonstrate it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This thing is much bigger than any one of us. Goodwin, please clear Colter's memories and re-initialize Source Code. Rutledge walks away. The technician gives Goodwin a look of disgust. Goodwin carefully replaces the citation into the envelope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mission Control. Panels, consoles and screens. Goodwin takes a seat at his workstation. He swings a microphone up and goes to flip a switch. Then stops. Unsure how to proceed. Looks down at the envelope with the citation in it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Inside the capsule, the silence continues. Colter thinks to himself. The MONITOR then comes on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain, this is Beleaguered Castle. Acknowledge transmission.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .F.B. - DAY Rutledge walks by himself. Reflecting. Pleased with himself. Under his breath, he acknowledges the praises he's imagining in his head:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, sir... I appreciate your faith in me... It's a great day for our country.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colter looks out at Goodwin. A beat of difficult silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How are you feeling? Are you comfortable?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just do it. I knew they wouldn't let me die. At least you can make me forget all of this. I hope. Goodwin stares at his hands. Unmoving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you waiting for? You're just doing your job. I'd do the same thing if I was you. At least you've got a shot at saving those people on the bridges.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I doubt it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't think they'll save them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I meant, I doubt you'd be doing this, if you were me. An unusually personal statement, coming from Goodwin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, someone had to be where you're sitting, and someone had to be in here. Turned out it was you and me. (THEN) Just do it. I'm tired.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like to see Christina again? One last time? Colter's not sure he heard him right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seventeen minutes. That's all I could give you. No mission to fulfill. Just... the two of you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would you do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As a favor. One prisoner to another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prisoner?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were right. About me. And about Source Code. We've kept too much from each other. An odd sensation comes over Colter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I usually report in at 0600. Today I was there early. I was there when the call came in. Your call. His call? They share a long look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... There's no way... There's no way you could have... Goodwin just smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How? The Source Code was a parallel world! You told me so! It's hermetically sealed. Nothing I did on that train would have any effect on this reality!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were on the train. I was not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We didn't know if any bleed- throughs could occur. The implications would be staggering. That's why you were told to avoid unduly influencing events.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're saying I could have saved those people?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Not in our world. The time currents are too strong. But minor alterations, here and there, a phone call, say, those might slip through. We didn't know for sure. But you proved it. Colter is thunderstruck. Unable to grasp it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been thinking about the things you said on that call. As the day passed, the more I understood them. And now, I guess we've caught up to each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man. Just when I think I understand this...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's not much time. They think I'm re-initializing the system. One last look at her. That's all I can give you. If that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They'll nail your ass for this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I had any feelings, I'd worry about that. But, as you've maintained, I do not. The strange path of their relationship. Ending at last at simple, grudging respect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roger that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Beleaguered Castle signing off. Acknowledge final transmission.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Final transmission acknowledged. (BEAT) Thank you, Goodwin. Goodwin interrupts his preparation for a last look at Colter. The noise gets louder. The capsule begins to shake. Colter touches the monitor. His fingers imparting to the last image of his world a quiet benediction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .F.B. - DAY Sipping a cup of coffee, Rutledge lingers at a window, contemplating his future.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Dr. Rutledge, extension 16. Blinking out of reverie, he goes over to a wall phone and punches an extension.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Rutledge. He listens. His face darkens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit. He SLAMS down the phone and starts RUNNING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colter is back on the train. It is morning again, seventeen minutes before the destruction. He's back in the navy blazer. The slacks. The commuters, caught up in their individual concerns, ignore Colter. But he looks on them with an appreciation approaching joy. For a moment he just sits there. Simply being alive in this world. Attuned to the motion of the train. The sun on his face. And across from him, oblivious, working away on her sketch pad, is Christina. The best sight of all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .F.B. - DAY Banks of MACHINERY are RUNNING. Rutledge comes charging in. Flustered. Barking questions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is this? Who authorized this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't know, sir. But Source Code is up and running again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Goodwin? The chair at the console is EMPTY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No idea, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ticks down from 17 minutes: 15:28... 15:27...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell is he doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colter drinks in the sight of Christina. Finally he gets up and walks off down the aisle. As soon as he's gone, Christina looks up. She's observed his interest in her. Doesn't quite know what to make of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colter is by himself in the exit door area. From his jacket he takes out a CELL PHONE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he dials 9-1-1. The call connecting...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . What is the nature of your emergency?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rutledge watches the computers churn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut it down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut down the Source Code. Right now. The technician hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine. I'll do it myself. Rutledge sits down at the controls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't do that. Rutledge gives a dismissive snort. And yet he pauses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've never interrupted Source Code in mid run. We'd have to literally pull the plug. It could damage the processors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let it finish, then. No harm in that, I guess. (OMINOUS) All of you are in deep shit, I promise you. As for Goodwin, he'll never make it off this base. Rutledge picks up a phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think that's where he's headed. Rutledge considers. And then catches on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He wouldn't. Looks up at the technician. Grows more and more uneasy. Snapping his attention back to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which reads: 12:42. Before it hits 12:41, Rutledge is already out of his chair and RUNNING for the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seal the ICU. I want a detachment of MPs meeting me on the way there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colter walks down the aisle. Looks at HIS WATCH -- 12 minutes, 40 seconds. The train begins to SLOW DOWN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Now approaching Newark Station. Newark Station, next stop. The Computer Engineer begins to wake up. As he does, Colter passes by, deftly slipping the borrowed cell phone back into the engineer's hand without being noticed. Derek packs up his things. We see him hide his wallet into a gap in the seat cushions and get up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The College Kid, also getting up, notices Derek's wallet, picks it up and hurries after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, you dropped this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow. Thanks. Keeping his composure, Derek accepts the wallet. Colter steps aside, allowing them to pass. Allowing it all to happen. The station slides into view. No one on the platform.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .F.B. - DAY Rutledge furiously descends, shoving people out of his way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .F.B. - DAY Rutledge runs up to a locked door and swipes his access card through the scanner. It comes up RED.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?! He tries again. Red. The door stays LOCKED.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The train comes to a halt. Unlike before, the doors stay shut for SEVERAL SECONDS LONGER than usual. Derek waits quietly at the doors. Finally they open. Derek steps out onto the platform, together with the Old Man, the College Kid and Guzman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Newark Station. Colter remains on board, standing in the exit area, watching. As usual, Derek quickly flips his wallet onto the next car and starts toward the station house. Guzman is ahead of him, already pushing open the doors to the station. All is quiet. Perhaps too quiet. Derek approaches the station and sees
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In station lobby are POLICE OFFICERS. Derek's jaw tightens. He changes course, heading instead for an outdoor stairwell. Coming UP the stairs, however, are more POLICE OFFICERS. Wheeling around, Derek heads the other way. Walking faster, but keeping his head. Not running, not panicking. The train, oddly, is still sitting there. As he nears the other end of the platform, MORE OFFICERS appear from behind columns, cutting off his escape. The police are coming from all sides, converging on the platform. Yet no one panics. No one runs. Finally -- POLICE COMMANDER (CALLING OUT) Derek Frost. Derek goes to get back on the train. The doors, however,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in his face. Through the closed doors, Derek looks in at Colter, still on the train. They stare at one another through the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Frost. Please turn to face us. An entire PHALANX OF POLICE OFFICERS is on the platform.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course. What's this about? Unseen by the officers, Derek has taken out his CELL PHONE and is DIALING IT as he turns around. The police approach, cautiously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Place your hands in the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My pleasure. Raising his hands, he pushes SEND on his phone. On board the train there's a RINGING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The DETONATOR PHONE has been removed from the bomb and now rings harmlessly in the hand of the train's SECURITY OFFICER. The restroom door is open and swarming with conductors examining the bomb. On the platform, the officers tackle Derek, subduing him. Passengers watch at the windows, mesmerized.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Once again, please return to your seats, ladies and gentlemen. No way. No one's moving from the windows. Except for Colter, who stands off by himself. The first look of satisfaction we've ever seen on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .F.B. - DAY An ALARM is going off. At a locked door, an Air Force
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is in the process of disabling the key pad. Rutledge paces, livid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to know who reprogrammed this lock. And if you don't get this open in ten seconds I'll see that you're busted back down to private.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm already a private, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just open it! A man's life is at stake. The key pad goes GREEN and the pressure lock releases. Rutledge tears open the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .F.B. - DAY Armed MILITARY POLICE clatter down the steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .F.B. - DAY Goodwin enters. He locks another door behind him. He is shaken but nevertheless going forward. In the chamber, three
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: monitor gauges and screens. One of them stands up to block his way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, I can't let you pass. Goodwin removes the patch on his uniform to reveal the insignia of a major.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Step aside. That's an order.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We all know your rank, Goodwin, but I have explicit orders from Rutledge not to -- BAM! Goodwin drops the Medic with a splintering HEADBUTT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm glad you know my rank. Were you also aware I'm in the Special Forces?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The train has been evacuated as police investigators search the rest of the cars. Hoards of passengers fill the platform as conductors try to herd them towards the station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Ladies and gentlemen, rail service has been cancelled. Please clear the platform and proceed into the station. New Jersey Transit apologizes for the inconvenience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Police cars parked everywhere. Two DETECTIVES are questioning the Computer Engineer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you have no idea how your cell phone was used to call in the tip?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! People mill about waiting for the buses, groaning and complaining. Christina accosts a passing transit employee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What now? How do we get to work? You guys have some busses or something? The transit employee ignores her and walks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! I'm talking to you! She stands there in exasperation. This whole thing has been designed to thwart her. Nearby, Colter sits on a bench.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ain't life grand? Looking over, she notices him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Now I'm going get fired for being late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe that's a good thing. She gives him a sharp look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .F.B. - DAY Rutledge runs, now leading the detachment of MPs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shoot him if you have to, you hear me? The MPs exchange a look of annoyance at being ordered around by this guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .F.B. - DAY A heavy INNER DOOR has been opened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .F.B. - DAY The BEEPING of life support systems. The compressions of a ventilator. Goodwin approaches a GURNEY. A jungle of tubes and lines lead from the gurney into advanced machinery. A somber look on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Captain. As Goodwin edges forward, we reveal the bare foot of someone lying there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: reads 1 MINUTE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .F.B. - DAY At the facility's outer door, the locksmith goes to work on another panel as Rutledge and the MPs stand by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me twenty seconds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make it ten. Rutledge looks at HIS WATCH. It reads 52 SECONDS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON - COLTER'S WATCH It also reads 52 seconds. His work is done. He's saved her. Saved them all. At least this one time. Only she doesn't know that. Christina stands there, arms crossed, scowling at the parking lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could this day get any worse?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That train was taking you to a place you didn't want to be. But then you got off. And maybe that's a sign.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. If only. She takes out her cell phone. The stress of her day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm calling a cab. Maybe I'll only be somewhat late for work. Colter watches her, a quiet ache inside. Maybe some people don't want to be saved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .F.B. - DAY The noise from the outer door grows louder. The MPs are only seconds from getting inside. Goodman moves towards the life support equipment. As he does, we glimpse a horrifying sight: the upper half of Colter's body -- his real body -- inside a sterile tent of transparent plastic. His skull has been removed. A massive apparatus has been infused directly onto his brain. Goodwin takes a long, last look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you for your service. Time to go home. Goodwin's hand goes to the switch to shut off life support. His eyes on the clock. It reads 30 SECONDS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christina on the phone, waiting as it dials.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. She turns. Colter gets up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can do anything you want with your life. Starting right now. She's taken aback. He starts walking off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Metro Cab Dispatch. A long beat as she watches him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Hello...? Click. She shuts her phone. Beat. Is she crazy? She's baffled by her own action. And by this unusual guy here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait. Colter turns. She crosses her arms archly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't just expect someone to change her life just like that. At the very least... you'd have to buy that person coffee and explain your reasons. She waits for his response. Uneasy at putting herself out there. Colter's watch ticks down to the final seconds. His last moments in this world. He has only time enough for a final look of reassurance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe some other time. Disappointment flickers on her face. She turns to go. Behind her is a STONE WALL. A BICYCLE is parked against it. Colter's breath catches in his throat. This is it! This is the mysterious scene he's been seeing!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Hits ZERO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .F.B. - DAY THE DIGITAL TIMER - Also hits ZERO. The outer door OPENS. Rutledge RUSHES in, accompanied by MPs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arrest him! Goodwin backs away from the gurney, hands in the air. The BEEPING has given way to a MONOTONE. All of Colter's vital signs have FLATLINED.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's dying...! Rutledge frantically goes to reconnect the machines -- but Goodwin has turned off too many of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get a medical team in here! Move! But the MPs just stare at the appalling sight of Colter's exposed brain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you standing there for?! Do it! We can save him!!! No one moves. Rutledge rashly grabs for one of the MP's rifles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess force is the only thing you people understa -- MP Back away, sir, now! The MP has leveled his rifle at Rutledge. Who steps back, aghast. His authority has vanished with Colter's life. Goodwin shuts off the monitors. Silence fills the room. Colter is dead. Rutledge stares sorrowfully at Colter's body. Then at Goodwin with burning hatred.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a murderer. Goodwin offers his hands to the MP.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go ahead and arrest me. But the MP does nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be around. Whenever you want me. They part as he walks out of the room. A look of grim satisfaction on his face.
direction.name: direction
